The doctor is an extremely nice and friendly person. She conducts the examination very thoroughly before making a diagnosis, ordering additional tests. Extremely empathetic, friendly, and at the same time you immediately sense enormous knowledge and practice in the profession. I wholeheartedly recommend. I haven't felt so cared for by a specialist doctor in a long time, none of my information about my health condition was trivialized or overlooked.

I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Anna. The doctor is very nice, friendly, approaches people with empathy. A doctor by vocation, an exceptional person. Committed to what she does. She conducted a very detailed interview and neurological examination. I had been to several other neurologists before visiting the doctor, and none of them examined me and questioned me about various details as thoroughly as the doctor. From each I only heard "that's just how you are," "you just have it that way." However, the doctor looked more deeply into my case. She devoted a lot of time to me, sufficiently enough. She ordered a series of tests to be done, indicated where best to perform them, gave advice and guidance on how to live and cope with my ailments. After the visit with the doctor, my husband and I were shocked that such doctors even exist, we had never met such an exceptional and competent doctor before.
The doctor is very nice, committed and empathetic. Comprehensive interview and many suggestions regarding the cause of the disease, diagnostics and treatment.

I would like to warmly recommend Dr. Anna as an exceptional neurologist. She is a very competent, committed and empathetic person. During the visit, everything was explained thoroughly, I felt listened to and cared for! Thank you very much!
It's been a long time...or maybe never, that I've met such a good doctor. With such commitment and knowledge.
The doctor is a physician with great empathy, commitment and enormous knowledge in her specialty. I wish there were more doctors with such an approach to patients.

I arrived on time. There were 3 ladies at the reception, but only 1 was working. After 20 minutes, i.e., 20 minutes late, I was at the office door. Appointments scheduled every 20 minutes. I waited for the patient to come out. The doctor came out with a patient after 45 minutes and informed me that either someone would let me in or I had to wait until the end of the day. Complete lack of respect for someone's time

I went to the doctor in December in a serious condition, suddenly bedridden for 2 months with a feeling of fainting, referred to a neurologist. Suspicions fell on tetany due to magnesium deficiency, because only 2 weeks of supplementation allowed me to even get to the clinic. I chose the doctor based on comments about empathy, thoroughness and the description that she treats tetany
